moves.1. f4:
I use to play the Bird's opening,and did OK with it for sometime,till I encountered the Frome Gambit.
I play black here.
moves.1... e5: My objective in the Bird is to castle and attack on the king side,the Frome throws that out the window.
moves.2. fxe5 d6: Playing against the Frome I learned early not to take the second offered pawn.
moves.3. Nf3 Nc6 4. exd6 Bxd6 5. e3 g5: Lasker variation,of the Frome,messing with the white knight.
moves.6. h3 Bg3+: Kicking the king into the open.
moves.7. Ke2 Qe7: More pressure on the king,and I want to castle queens side.
moves.12. d5 Nge7 13. Qb3: Whites development is cramped,both bishop's are neutered.
moves.13... Rxd5 14. Nd4 Nxd4+ 15. cxd4 Be4: Whites king is exposed,blacks king is quite safe.
moves.16. Nc3 Qf2+ 17. Kd1 Qxe3 18. Bc4 Rxd4+: Dbl. check white has to move the king.

gameName: Why I no longer play the Birds.
